data.what_is:
Klaviyo powers smarter digital relationships with an intelligent marketing automation platform that is fueled by all of your customer and designed from day one for scale. 

Built on a flexible, real-time database that centralizes all your customer data -- from your entire tech stack, for any length of time, in full granular detail -- Klaviyo makes it easy to create, deliver, and optimize incredibly sophisticated and personalized experiences across email, SMS, mobile apps, reviews, the web, paid ads, and more.

Join more than 130K paying customers using Klaviyo to increase conversions and customer lifetime value -- and grow on their own terms. Learn more at klaviyo.com.
data.product_description: Klaviyo, a unified customer platform for email, SMS, and more, gives your online brand direct ownership of your consumer data and interactions.Klaviyo is the world's leading intelligent marketing automation and customer data platform known for accelerating revenue for online businesses using the channels they own like email, SMS, in-app notifications, and web. Enabling companies to leverage these owned marketing channels, Klaviyo makes it easy to store, access, analyze and use transactional and behavioral data to power highly targeted customer and prospect communications. And unlike other marketing platforms, Klaviyo doesn't force companies to compromise between advanced functionality or ease of use--so companies of all sizes are able to maximize their sales quickly. That's why over 100,000 innovative companies like Unilever, Custom Ink and Glossier sell more with Klaviyo.

initial_reviews.review_title: Klaviyo is terrible for business, and they're getting worse

The only benefit is the network effect. There's more agencies, partners, and individuals that have experience with their platform. This makes it easier to hire people and get more resources. But that' sit.

What do you dislike about Klaviyo?
Stay away and use someone else!

We've been with them for four years and it's gotten ridiculous. We had to spend 1200 for an email that had generated $200 in revenue. A complete ripoff.

There's better options. Support is the worst. At some point, they were the only players in the ecommerce game. Things have changed. Stay away because they will steal from you when you have actual volume.

There's competitors and people are adopting them fast. Most companies we know are leaving Klaviyo because they are too expensive for what they offer.

What problems is Klaviyo solving and how is that benefiting you?
This ones obvious: we email our customers. Communication is important for your brand, company, and profitability. Unfortunatley we are not profitable with klaviyo.

initial_reviews.review_title: Great experience with Klaviyo
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Klaviyo?
It provides easy-to-use templates for automations and campaigns. For a beginner, this would be the perfect free email marketing app anyone could consider. As long as your email lsit is below 500 emails per month.

What do you dislike about Klaviyo?
The one thing I dislike about Klaviyo is that they have a monthly limit to the amount of emails a user can send per month. If they increased this or just got rid of it entirely, this would be a lot more benificial to faster growing companies who are not ready to pay for a business plan with Klaviyo yet.

What problems is Klaviyo solving and how is that benefiting you?
A problem that my campaigns are dealing with currently, is overlapping and spamming. I realized recently that shopify already provides an automated campaign for emails that are sent to viewers who either abandon their cart, purchased an item, or made other important actions. Klaviyo was able to show me that there are drops in open rates, with certain emails only since they were basically sent twice by two different providers. This helped me fix a major problem with that.

What do you like best about Klaviyo?
- Segmentation is really easy, they provide a lot of attributes and parameters based on which you can create new segments
- A lot of access control levels are there so I could ensure different members in my team have different accesses across
- Their showcase/bank of emails and SMS is a nice place to look up new ideas for emails and SMSs

all_reviews.review_title: Important part of stack, but hard to integrate with anything else
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Klaviyo?
Klaviyo is valuable for setting up a chain of emails to communicate with existing or prospective customers, configured by decision-tree and A/B testing. It also has a built-in email-address collection form mechanism and will also track people in profiles that can be data-crunched in different ways later.

What do you dislike about Klaviyo?
It's unfortunately very, very hard to integrate Klaviyo's profile data with other parts of my tech stack, and for that reason, it sucks as a Customer Data Platform. For instance, Klaviyo knows who the current user is in on any given session... but if I want to use Klaviyo's profile data to track the current session's profile ID or email address in other parts of my tech stack, I can't.

Klaviyo *used* to allow you to grab the email address associated with the current user straight out of the current session cookie, and then pass that on to, for example, Lucky Orange, so that I could later see a click-and-activity heatmap for a specific user. But Klaviyo no longer provides that ability to get an email address from the session cookie, and I've had to come up with kludgy less-perfect ways to tie session data across apps. If Klaviyo would allow for this kind of data to be accessible like it used to, then Klaviyo would be the central "gold standard" central data store for my stack... but instead it's just one of the fringe elements, usable mainly only for sending marketing emails.

What problems is Klaviyo solving and how is that benefiting you?
Klaviyo marketing emails track to the place in a funnel that a user left off, so I'm able to get a second bite at the apple with prospective (but not actual) buyers whose addresses I've collected, e.g., from Wheelio. It also, theoretically, could help me encourage buyers to come back for repeat business, though I've been less successful with this.

Klaviyo solves how to communicate with customers in a 1:1 way.

Klaviyo has excellent integration with Shopify, arguably the best in the industry. I represent an agency, we've partnered with Klaviyo to offer this solution to our clients and we couldn't ask for more in terms of the solution and the journey they provide to merchants and our internal team.

The platform can be as complex or as simple as merchant requirements dictate, which is great as we work with brands through various stages of growth. Having the knowledge that the solution is scalable as they grow certainly gives merchants peace of mind.

The single best feature would be the sheer amount of integrations available. For merchants with a growing tech stack, it's vital that data is passed between tools so merchants have a holistic and actionable view of interactions.

What do you dislike about Klaviyo?
I feel that Klaviyo could be an 'intimidating' choice for those merchants that have particularly basic requirements for emails. If you're occasionally sending campaigns and aren't interested in automation, building profiles and really making the data work - it's unlikely you'll see value from this product.

What problems is Klaviyo solving and how is that benefiting you?
Klaviyo allows greater accuracy in targeting the right customers (or prospective customers), at the right time. This is driven by the data that the platform passively collects via integrations or user consent. This means that the likelihood of engagement is significantly higher. More engagement = higher LTV.

What do you like best about Klaviyo?
Their 'features' if they worked. But they don't.

What do you dislike about Klaviyo?
1) Their text editor has multiple useability issues. Does not show the actual preview of what you'll get in the email, the preview pane and the text editor show two different things so I have no choice but to continuously send test emails just to see what it will actually look like. Plus, elements move out of position by themselves whenever they feel like it from the time I'm in the editor to the time I send a test email.
2)  Their flow logic is broken. We set up an email flow to email customers that purchased twice, the flow added customers that purchased only once. We had thousands of confused customers after they received the email from the wrong flow before we realized what was happening. Oh, and after 3 weeks we still have not heard back from tech support on this issue...
3) THIS IS THE MOST DAMAGING ISSUE FOR US AS A BUSINESS:
They "guarantee" deliverability (you would think "to the inbox"). Well, we are not getting this - - their reports SAY the emails are being delivered, but many of them, especially to Gmail addresses, are going to spam - we know this for a FACT because we ask our customers! After many hours and days of troubleshooting this issue, we've disovered exactly why this issue exists:

A) They use blacklisted IPs. Obviously, the blacklistings are NOT their fault. However, they refuse to clean them. DMARC reports I receive consistently show 3 out of 4 IPs are on at least one blacklist.
B) The big issue we're having with DMARC is that the IPs they send emails with are not in our SPF records so they won't authenicate - emails sent from those IPs look like they could be coming from someone else. I asked them for a list of the IPs they use and they refuse to give it to me. This means that no matter what we do with this company, we will never be able to authenticate our emails and thus they will fail DMARC - which also means we can't set DMARC to anything but NONE.
C) They refuse to provide us with a dedicated IP because we're not big enough. We have doubled our spend just in the last 6 months with them, and currently spend $600 a month, but they want us to spend $1500 a month minimum before we can get a dedicated IP.

So it looks like we're going to break up with Klaviyo, which is too bad because to us, it appears they have this "we're too big to fail" attitude.

What problems is Klaviyo solving and how is that benefiting you?
They are creating more problems than they solve. We're finding that PPC is becoming more expensive by the day as the economy gets worse. Conversions are more expensive to the point where we realize that the way forward is using SEO, outreach, and especially email campaigns to facilitate growth. However, not having an email platform that can provide the deliverability we need greatly lessens those opportunities for us.

all_reviews.review_title: If you run an Ecommerce you need this.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Klaviyo?
Klaviyo has made it incredibly simple to create personalized campaigns and automated sequences to move your customers (and potential customers) through each stage of the buying cycle.   Prior to using Klaviyo we essentially had one email list and very little segmentation, and because of this nearly everyone received the same email blast.  Now we have welcome sequences for people that opt into our email list, cart abandonment sequences, browse abandonment sequences, winback sequences for people that haven't bought in a while, and more.

The Facebook integration is also a nice touch because it allows us to automatically update our Facebook audiences as people join our list or make a purchase.

What do you dislike about Klaviyo?
There isn't a lot to fault with Klaviyo, but the two I would say are probably the biggest are the price and the support.  We utilize enough of the automation and segmentation tools to justify the cost, but it's something that you need to consider before joining.

Secondly, support is limited to email and live chat.  This can be tricky if you have a problem that requires immediate support.

What problems is Klaviyo solving and how is that benefiting you?
Klaviyo has allowed us to introduce powerful segmentation, allowing us to send relevant messages to customers at each point in the buying cycle, rather than sending email blasts to everyone on our list.

all_reviews.review_title: Easy to Use Email Campaign Service
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Klaviyo?
As a small business, we use Klaviyo to send email campaigns about 6 times per year. Klaviyo has incredible customer support that has helped us a few times when needed. The email flow feature has been incredibly useful for our business and the way it's easy to segment customers is very useful. The email Subject Line Assistant is a great feature too. Looking forward to Klaviyo's partnership with Shopify. If the two are more integrated, that would put Klaviyo at the top of the list!

What do you dislike about Klaviyo?
Would appreciate even more email templates to choose from or possibly an integration with Canva? We don't like the lack of customization when it comes to email creation. Without having to enter custom HTML code, the drag and drop editor could be better. Specifically, we'd like to use more fonts and have a smoother transition between mobile and desktop email customization. We want to enter specific font sizes when it comes to mobile and desktop fonts and not have to choose from a preselected font size from a drop-down menu.

What problems is Klaviyo solving and how is that benefiting you?
Klaviyo is helping us send automatic emails to new newsletter subscribers and helping us email automatic discount codes to customers that sign up to receive email notifications from us in the future.

all_reviews.review_title: Simple UI let down by incessant bugs
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Klaviyo?
It's drag and drop feature for creating emails makes creating email templates easy. I like the ability to easy edit Flows.

What do you dislike about Klaviyo?
The template software is probably the most bug-ridden software I have ever used. My company is an online SaaS software company and I would be embarrassed to allow something with so many bugs go into production. I think the amount of time I have spent creating Flows and editing Email templates is probably double what it should be due to the number of bugs I have come across and the number of times I have been forced to redo something because Klaviyo has hit a bug and forced me to refresh the browser and lose all my current work.

Klaviyo has mostly been good with responding to my support issues but when I came across the latest but I needed some help to resolve it. I tried the online chat function - it was offline (that's fine, I don't expect that to be functioning 24/7). So then I tried their support contact form to send them a message - an error prevented me from sending the message - no matter how many times I tried revising the message (and even trying a different browser). So I resorted to sending them an email directly. I got an instant reply, horrah! Unfortunately, the reply stated that they no longer respond to emails and that I should login and contact them through the support contact form! I CAN'T!!! IT DOESN'T WORK. I had to resort to send them a tweet.

An email marketing company that you cannot communicate with - this does not instill confidence.

After the first 3-4 weeks of using the software, I received an email saying Klaviyo had been hacked and my account was compromised. Great start!

This is my first time using an email marketing software service and I am beginning to regret it. I will persevere for a little while longer, but any more issues and I will jumping ship to a more established company.

What problems is Klaviyo solving and how is that benefiting you?
Sending emails marginally more customized than what I had created manually to send from my server.

all_reviews.review_title: Wordpress and Woocommerce compatible email marketing solution
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Klaviyo?
We love the detailed customer tracking that happens in real-time. The data collected allows for advanced segmentation so that newsletters and flows can be narrowed to convert. If you're not familiar with customizing dynamic data via API, there is a bit of a learning curve. But, they collect a lot of data and most of the customer's data can be accessed to craft custom flows and transmit dynamic data points such as cart items, shipping cost, shipping provider, shipping estimates, custom address, etc.

The new drag and drop editor is very nice and makes workflows move quickly. You can also access their design library, which has lots of templates to start from. Once you customize one of these with your branding, then you can save that template for future use. We've built 3 templates that we use on a regular basis - receipts, monthly specials, and new product announcements.

What do you dislike about Klaviyo?
Woocommerce integration isn't intuitive. We came from a system that had built-in receipts for transactions, shipping details, etc. These flows had to be built out manually using the API integration. This took me several weeks to figure out and despite having an account that we're paying nearly $5000 annually for, support was not super forthcoming with details, mainly referring to their KB. If I had more experience with API dev, the KB would likely be more than enough to solve my issue. But, I had zero experience with making these types of calls and even with the preview system, crafting the right snippet of code was problematic and set me back several times.

Also, this may only be with Wordpress, but our previous system integrated natively with WooCommerce's coupon system, Klaviyo does not. There has also been one issue that I has come up when putting emails on "smart send." When testing, it never sent out the emails until I took off the smart send feature. Also, when you ask that it takes 1 min to send the email form the trigger, it takes an additional 2-3 min.

Recommendations to others considering Klaviyo:
They have a lot of different options to utilize your email lists, which is great, but it may take some time to learn how it all works. Expect to take some time learning it.

What problems is Klaviyo solving and how is that benefiting you?
At the moment, I am creating an extensive amount of email sequences for different opt-in locations and landing pages. This is something that I am taking some time on before I can really lanch all the different sequences.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Klaviyo?
It works for a business that is just getting started with email marketing.  The thing they don't tell you is that their plans are based on the number of active profiles, not on the number of subscribers.  An active profile is any email contact that is not suppressed, including subscribers and non-subscribers, as well as customers and non-customers.  They also bill SMS and email separately.  When you use the free plan, you are limited to sending a maximum of 500 emails per month.  One of the options that you can do with the paid plan is to remove the Klaviyo branding in the email footer.  If you want to setup multiple flows for abandoned cart, product reviews and a welcome series, you can't do this on their free plan.

What do you dislike about Klaviyo?
Free plan is very limited, the $20 a month plan is too costly for most startups that aren't emailing their list very much.

What problems is Klaviyo solving and how is that benefiting you?
It integrates with Shopify

An active profile is any email contact that is not suppressed, including subscribers and non-subscribers, as well as customers and non-customers.  They also bill SMS and email separately.  When you use the free plan, you are limited to sending a maximum of 500 emails per month.  One of the options that you can do with the paid plan is to remove the Klaviyo branding in the email footer.  If you want to setup multiple flows for abandoned cart, product reviews and a welcome series, you can't do this on their free plan.

We use Klaviyo for weekly communication with our customers, sending sale information, coupons, and general updates, be they around Covid or just personnel changes.

all_reviews.review_title: The Best Email and SMS Marketing Automation Platform in the Business!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Klaviyo?
Overall, it comes down to simplicity. All the features that you could need elegantly put into an intuitive package. The segment builder, for example, is the best of its kind in any marketing platform I have ever used. Flow logic feels intuitive and not intimidating. They even provide so many templates for all parts of their platform, along with tons of resource documents, to help new brands get the most out of Klaviyo.

But really, the best part of Klaviyo starts with its people. Having been a brand using Klaviyo for half a decade now, it is incredible to see how much their team cares about driving new features that impact businesses. Their project managers, account managers, and technical experts are all top-notch. They constantly seek feedback and ask what would be a helpful tool for brands. SMS is the recent example of coming in and making it what it should be and charging a fair price.

What do you dislike about Klaviyo?
Klaviyo is primarily for Shopify stores at has the best connection, so would be good to see more connections and a tighter Magento connection. But magento is a big beast and more stores are switching to Shopify for many reasons, Klaviyo being one of the valid reasons to switch.

What problems is Klaviyo solving and how is that benefiting you?
Increasing revenue and our level of ownership in the customer journey. The features themselves include: Email Campaigns, SMS Campaigns, Flows and Automations, Sign up Forms and List Growth, Analytics and Business Intellegence, Facebook Targeting Integration, Segments, Preference Center, Profile Management, and more.

all_reviews.review_title: Email Marketing: Klaviyo gets the job done!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Klaviyo?
I like how Klaviyo integrates with our website and makes eCommerce simple and easy to manage - to an extent.  More on that later. I can easily clean up my audiences and keep engaged email users on top of my list and get strong ROI. The templates are also designer-friendly, as well as, user-friendly! I am a jack of all trades in my position, so it's nice to have pre-made templates that make it simpler to get content out to our users.

Another aspect of this software is that it is easy to navigate. Everything is clean and right where I think I would put it. It was definitely designed for the busy marketer in mind!

What do you dislike about Klaviyo?
This isn't Klaviyo's fault but their API doesn't integrate with our Magento platform. However, our website team has customized the platform so much that it's no fault to Klaviyo.

I do wish Klaviyo had better templates and a few more innovative aspects to building emails, e.g. more design options for cleanliness and optimal layouts. I will "shop" other retail stores and see what they do with their email marketing campaigns and I find myself wishing for automation and different email features.

Recommendations to others considering Klaviyo:
I recommend outlining your needs with email marketing first. Once you know what your objectives are with using this software, I promise that your return on it will skyrocket. It took us a little bit to figure out (due to the API integration on our website being funky), but once we got the ball rolling on high quality audiences, we were getting that return we aimed for!

What problems is Klaviyo solving and how is that benefiting you?
The problem was that I was not able to keep my audience organized and it made it difficult to market to the right categories, etc. that I wanted. With Klaviyo, I was able to segment and keep engaged email users at a top priority and ensured my email marketing efforts were seen by the right people! This benefited in saving time but maximizing our ROI for email marketing.

Another problem I had with our previous email marketing software was that html would sort of "bust open." I can't explain it but in some email inboxes, the code would just fall apart and users would get strings and strings of code. With Klaviyo, I never had an issue with that - not saying we coded our own emails - but emails would come in clean, would get a lot of clicks, and we were able to track what pages each email user were going to and we would make segmented audiences based on that data. A win-win!

review_question_answers.question: What do you like best about Klaviyo?

review_question_answers.question: What do you dislike about Klaviyo?

review_question_answers.question: What problems is Klaviyo solving and how is that benefiting you?

With Klaviyo, I was able to segment and keep engaged email users at a top priority and ensured my email marketing efforts were seen by the right people! This benefited in saving time but maximizing our ROI for email marketing.

Another problem I had with our previous email marketing software was that html would sort of "bust open." I can't explain it but in some email inboxes, the code would just fall apart and users would get strings and strings of code. all_reviews.review_title: Klaviyo is essential for automating your emails
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Klaviyo?
I was originally using MailChimp for my online business because of its easy integration with Shopify and cheap rates. In my opinion, Klaviyo offers better segmentation, customization, and automation of emails. Our open rates are higher, and more importantly, our emails are automated now so it's mostly hands off.

What do you dislike about Klaviyo?
It can take a while to get the hang of without connecting with an agent or taking a webinar. I found MailChimp a little easier to just pick up with no experience, but Klaviyo takes more training, trial and error, and research. Overall, totally worth the switch and time invested.

What problems is Klaviyo solving and how is that benefiting you?
Instead of manually sending out batch emails every week, Klaviyo has totally automated multiple flows for us and freed up some time. Where Shopify typically only offers 1-2 abandon cart emails and 1-2 welcome emails, Klaviyo gives you the option to build out flows that can keep your subscribers engaged with you for weeks or even months. Our abandon cart reminder went from 1 email to 5+, our welcome email for new customers turned into a welcome series, which frees up time to build out campaigns and one-off emails  while Klaviyo does the heavy lifting.

all_reviews.review_title: Love Klaviyo and their flows for email marketing and follow-ups
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Klaviyo?
Klaviyo is a great tool for creating email flows and retaining customers. It works by allowing you to set triggers and a flowchart. So, for example: "If customer abandons cart - wait 24 hours - send a follow-up email with a 20% Discount".

Where Klaviyo differs from other programs I have used is that they allow you to really create a flowchart which is super helpful. It means you can see your whole email flow in one place and seeing it visually really helps.

What do you dislike about Klaviyo?
The only thing I could think of is that I wish I could get more help setting it up. I had to google a lot to understand what the different terms, options, and settings are for creating a work flow. It did end up working perfectly, but would have been a lot easier to get these answers directly from Klaviyo.

What problems is Klaviyo solving and how is that benefiting you?
Klaviyo is solving the following problem: HOW CAN I GET BACK A CUSTOMER THAT ABANDONS HIS OR HER CART? Or how do I follow up with customers in a perfect manner?

Klaviyo lets you solve this by allowing you to set up a flow that can continue depending on the actions customers take. ie - makes 2 purchases - gets email "Thank You for ordering from us twice, here is 2 x 10% discounts for you for your next 2 orders".

The biggest benefits we have realized is that our customers keep ordering! Keep spending money!

I've used a variety of different email marketing platforms and Klaviyo has been one of the best. It's built for eCommerce and understands the needs for brands when it comes to email marketing and understanding how consumers behave. They have pre-built email automations so you can set up triggered flows quickly and effectively. There customer data is superb which allows for easy, tailored audience segmentation to really target the right audience with the right product, allowing for better open rates and conversions. It's quick to integrate with systems, customer service is strong and having used it with multiple store fronts, you can connect accounts which allows you easily to swap between and more importantly copy email templates over to different accounts which saves time having to build the same template twice. Building a good looking email is simple and it's just been one of the easiest to use, with professional outcomes and data to boot!

Not really anything they can do about it as not their fault they are based in different timezones from my company, but because of this and lack of 24hr customer support, you have to wait until late afternoon to be able to chat to anyone. They are quick to respond via email, but if you need something urgent, you can't get hold of anyone until the afternoon (GMT) because they are based in Boston

It's an incredible marketing platform and I would highly recommend.

It turns out that there was an apostrophe in the url which doesn't work with email links. This would be fine to rectify, but the fact the links worked in the test email means it's hard to pick up on an error like this, prior to an email being sent out.

2.  Automation.  Abandon carts, abandon views, customer reactivation, etc are a breeze to set up.
3.  Product catalog integration.  Can create funnels that automatically include products from your catalog.
4. Simple A/B testing.

It's great to have the control to analyze our customers, and figure out what we need to do from there, or what are the missed opportunities.

all_reviews.review_title: Klaviyo is now the only email platform I will recommend - even for large companies
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Klaviyo?
It's incredible that Klaviyo offers functionality on par with enterprise software such as Salesforce and Marketo, at a fraction of the price and no contracts! Smaller email platforms like Mailchimp are so far behind.

I actually think that functionality is even better in Klaviyo than large enterprise software because the UX design is easy to use and software speed is very fast. Something that takes me an hour in Salesforce Marketing Cloud  will take me 10 minutes in Klaviyo.. hence why I will only recommend Klaviyo now.

Klaviyo also allows all e-commerce and CRM data to be used for any profile, including items browsed, pages viewed, signup source, etc. This allows for advanced segmentation of customers.

Klaviyo also has a large help database  that answers most of my questions, and great support for anything else.

Solution: you just need to pick a setting and use that consistently each reporting period.

Recommendations to others considering Klaviyo:
This is the best email marketing software out there today, even for large businesses. The ease of use and functionality will save you many headaches, and the price will make you extremely happy. Support is great too... all boxes checked.

With Klaviyo I've been able to create advanced automations, segmentations, and customer profiles that are way more superior than other email marketing software. This has increased revenue tremendously.

I have also done this in a fraction of the time! Which saves me from stress and is priceless.

Some of the funniest features, such as surveys and interesting signup forms, are missing, but there are a few additions to help you.

all_reviews.review_title: Powerful But There's a Learning Curve
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Klaviyo?
The service itself is a great autoresponder with so many options. But honestly the best part about Klaviyo is their customer service. Their live chat is AWESOME and will respond quickly and politely to help you solve problems. I've had to use them more than once and was pleasantly surprised how easy it was to get help that was very useful.

What do you dislike about Klaviyo?
We use Klaviyo to connect to Shopify. While not overly complicated, it can take a while to set up and it's easy to get lost in the back and forth weeds between the two services. One thing I found frustrating was that when setting up a new category for products in Shopify, that category would not show up on the Klaviyo side until a purchase was made on Shopify for that category. That added an unnecessary step and created a time lag for making new flows for new categories.

Recommendations to others considering Klaviyo:
Think about what your needs are and research Klaviyo carefully. It's a great service but some of the features take a while to learn and set up. Depending on your business, it may be more autoresponder than you realistically need. While I like it a lot, if I were to start again I would maybe choose something simpler (not sure what that would be and don't get me wrong, I do like Klaviyo, but I've put more time into it than I'd initially wanted to).

What problems is Klaviyo solving and how is that benefiting you?
We needed an autoresponder to help follow up with people after purchases, send out bulk mails, and grow our email list. Although some of the features can take a while to learn and set up, it's really cut down on our customer service tickets.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Klaviyo?
The Style/CSS editor is amazing. It takes some getting used to but once you get the hang of it designing beautiful emails is easy.

Deliverability is high for us. We range in the 15-40% open rates and it's helped immensely to place customers into a true journey based on behaviors.

Segmentation is powerful.

The open API allows us to integrate with our custom CMS and see multiple metrics that matter from every drip/campaign we send.

Seemlessl integration with tons of other third parties, like Typeform, Facebook Lead Campaigns, Zapier, etc.


What do you dislike about Klaviyo?
When you're getting started, the customer support can be a bit lacking.

Honestly I use Klaviyo's hell so little now that it's a small irritation at best but for someone who is just learning I could see this as being a huge frustration. They do have a live chat but it's hrd to find.

Recommendations to others considering Klaviyo:
Dive in head first. Learn to use the flows feature and build custom metrics. Great if you have a Shopify powered store.

What problems is Klaviyo solving and how is that benefiting you?
E-commerce, custom platform.

What do you dislike about Klaviyo?
I left my last provider because of a few reasons, but service / support was a big factor. With Klaviyo, during set-up and start-up I was constantly being contacted and then once we kind of rolled out, the support is now limited to email support - unfortunately our several instances installed on Magento have created some overlap and the support has been OK, but not as great as I would like. I'm more of a phone support person, it;s easier when discussing complexities and I feel a little pushed back with their support up to this point.

Don't wait another day to switch, YTD 2017 vs 2016, my email revenue for only 1 website I manage is up 173%. 85% of that increase is due to the automation Klaviyo provides.

What problems is Klaviyo solving and how is that benefiting you?
Every email mktg seminar I've attended always covered customer segmentation; how essential it is, how needed it is and how it's the future - yet, no platform I came across offered a tool that allowed segmentation without extensive exporting, importing and filtering excel docs. If I want to email my customers who have made a purchase in the last 3 months, without opening any other marketing emails and has spent over $125 I can create that segment in literally 3 minutes. No exporting, no manual data manipulation, etc.

Every flow/ series you can think of is pre-templated, ready to go and out of the box; welcome, adandoned cart, winbacks, browse abandonment, new customer, repeat customer, etc etc.

all_reviews.review_title: It's as if I had the budget to hire a person to manage my email marketing strategy + implementation
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Klaviyo?
It's as if I had the budget to hire a person to manage my entire non-transactional email marketing strategy and implementation. I'd say so far I like the rules setup the best, segmenting my flows and campaigns to make sure I'm only hitting up people who 1) are interested in what I have to say right now, 2) Are the right audience for my current message/in-store sale announcement, etc and/or 3) Have not heard a similar message anytime recently. My other favorite is the easy integrations with other apps I'm using to manage my eCommerce and Digital marketing systems.

What do you dislike about Klaviyo?
I've been using it for about two months now, and I have a few blindspots that I cannot intuit from the interface, which is a problem for me. I do not like that there are no training calls. I do wish they could take over transactional emails from BigCommerce - who butchers the process, but the sales rep said they cannot do that right now.

Recommendations to others considering Klaviyo:
I can only say evaluate several competitors and get the full demo before signing up with any one service. Several key issues were not even clear to me until I went through the demos. Klaviyo solved more of my pain points than any other system, but that might just be for my business.

What problems is Klaviyo solving and how is that benefiting you?
Who has time for REALLY GREAT newsletters and multiple well-timed follow-ups (including mining for emails in the POS system) when you are running an entire eCommerce and Digital Marketing department for a multi-million dollar company single-handedly? The newsletters got written eventually but clumsily, and not as often as I'd like. Follow-ups, re-engagement campaigns, customer winbacks, cart and browse abandonment were either 1) not a thing or 2) a dry affair automated without the addition of rules to secure the right audience. Klaviyo changed everything, we are now rocking and rolling on a new level. We have been able to attribute our newsletter to several big sales, and customer winback campaigns are working based on the sales data as well. I had no visibility to who was responding favorably and to what content, because I could not get budget for a large MAP. This platform is affordable for relatively small marketing budgets, yet very powerful, so far.
